intro: Bacopa pennellii, commonly known as the aquatic bacopa, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its small, blue or purple flowers and its ability to thrive in wet or aquatic environments. The plant has opposite, oval-shaped leaves that are often submerged or floating. Bacopa pennellii is part of the Scrophulariaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants. It is often used in water gardens and as a decorative plant in ponds.
